msContents.summary: This inscription is referred to the reign of Tribhuvanamalladēva (Vikramāditya VI)and records the gift of land made by Muṇḍeyara Śrīvanta Gāvuṇḍa to Nīlakaṇṭha Paṇḍitadēva, for the benefit of the temple of Mūlasthānadēva, built by him in the centre of the southern quarter of Narayaṅgal.

Oṃ! Praise to Śiva!

Obeisance to Śambhu, beauteous with the cāmara like crescent moon kissing his lofty head, the original foundation-pillar of the city of the three worlds.This is the translation here complete, from a well-known verse by Harṣa.
The joy wins the whole earth Śiva
The Caḷukya family, whose wife is the Fortune, the glorious abode in the succession, the spreading of spotless fame, the support of the entire world, shines on earth.

The Caḷukya kings, praised by many people, in succession: Jayasimha, the best jewel among kings, he who was born in that family in order to proceed and keep the earth protected with heroism, he who was famous for his incomparable strength, he who had a vast kingdom which is the surface of the entire earth, purified with the water of a sacred ford which is his own conduct.
From that famous king, his son Ahavamalla became king: the proud hero, whose arm was praised in the game of the battle, beloved to the earth, the best among the warriors

From that king Ahavamalla, his son Sōmēśvara, devoted to the kingdom, who was capable of lifting the weight of the earth, who had forgiveness, who was praised for his regal conduct, considered in the assembly, praised for his knowledge of astrology, who possessed of the four means of success, who was formidable by reason of being endowed with fierce valour, the famous Bhuvanaikamalla, the best among the best heroes. Thus, from that king, his younger brother Tribhuvanamalla became the the beautiful husband of earth, who had a great prowess, incomparable for the power of the arm of Kauntēya
Permāḍirājya shone on the earth to be well know for his order, his splendor, his greatness when there were no kings like him in the past, present and future

Hail! The victorious reign of the glorious Tribhuvanamalladēva, who was the ornament of the Cāḷukyas, the distinctive mark of the Satyāśrayakuḷa, the supreme venerable, the supreme Lord, the great king of the kings, the glorious pṛthivīvallabha, support of the earth
The prosperity of his reign was increasing perpetually as long as exists the spreading of the moon, the sun, the stars.

The kings of Sinda race, who were devoted to the Cāḷukya family, who were very valiant masters in the battle, the best heroes of the world, whose conduct was pure and well known, who were praised throughout the earth, the best leaders in the war, preceptors of the science of the war, supreme, incomparable among the best warriors who were possessed of the vigorous courage, they shone.

Born in that family, of great glory, skilled in various sciences, whose arm was terrible, he was a netfish jāḷa in conquering the enemies, and the protector of the earth, who was the high and the excellent hero, distinguished ruler, whose conduct is the vastness of his success, which is the glory (khyāti) of the Sinda’s lineage, King Ācugi obtained fame.
He of the incomparable valor in the battle-field of the Caḷukya kings: if one thinks about the king Acugi: "is there anyone else similar in the greatness to that valiant warrior?"
Like that, the brothers of the king Ācugi : king Nāka, king Siṃga, king Dāsa, king Dāva, king Caunda, king Cāva, they were very famous, they had eminent qualities.
Among them the king Caunda, who was known as the abode of glory and fortune, who was terrible in battle, whose force was his strength arm, that was terrible against all enemies

From that king, who has been described the king Bamma, the son of the king Acugi, whose the entire kingdom was well known, he who was dear to the woman by means of the might of his arm, the best among the capable kings and brave men, a eager bee to the glorious feet of lotus of the supreme lord for his great conduct, supporter of the earth, an ocean of qualities, a garland of glory obtained by learned men.

From that king, the king Ācugidēva, the abode of qualities, who had the knowledge in sciences and technique of weapons that was reknowned in the world, the distinguished chief, known as the husband of the kingdom Śrīnārī. Having acquired many forts, having attacked and pursued the bent kings; having destroyed the territories of the enemy kings, having acquired delightfully the glory originated from bright and virtuous actions; the king Āca the husband of the lovely woman which is the Fortune, became famous.

the King Vikrama, shining like the sun, in order to command, a lion in the battle, having pursued prevailed against the Hoysala, having taken Gōva, having destroyed in the battle Lakṣma by means of his might, having scattered Malapa, such as having defeated Pandyas in the battle, and seized the Konkan. Like that the great wife of main chieftain Ācarasa, known even now to be intent upon the dharma.
